snippet: Preparations moved swiftly for legalized same-sex marriage in six other states where bans were almost certain to be overturned in coming days and weeks.
abstract: Gay couples in Indiana, Oklahoma, Utah, Virginia and Wisconsin rush to get married after Supreme Court refuses to hear any of the same-sex marriage appeals before it; same-sex marriage bans are almost certain to be overturned in six other states as a result of the ruling.

byline.original: By JACK HEALY, MICHAEL D. SHEAR and ERIK ECKHOLM
byline.contributor: Jack Healy reported from Salt Lake City; Michael D. Shear from Arlington, Va.; and Erik Eckholm from New York. Reporting was contributed by Carol Cole-Frowe from Oklahoma City; Jennifer Dobner from Salt Lake City; Alan Blinder from Atlanta; Libby Sander from Arlington; Joel Elliott from LaGrange,  Ind.; and Dirk Johnson from Milwaukee.

lead_paragraph: Preparations moved swiftly for legalized same-sex marriage in six other states where bans were almost certain to be overturned in coming days and weeks.

headline.main: Scenes of Exultation in Five States as Gay Couples Rush to Marry
headline.print_headline: Scenes of Exultation in Five States as Gay Couples Rush to Marry

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
